snippet: Gov. David Ige of Hawaii said the group building the telescope, one of the world’s largest, had agreed to pause construction to allow interested parties to have more discussions about the project.
abstract: Hawaiian Gov David Ige says construction of Thirty Meter Telescope at Mauna Kea will stop for a week to allow for more discussions about project, which has been protested against by those sympathetic to natives who hold peak of Mauna Kea sacred.
lead_paragraph: Gov. David Ige of Hawaii said the group building the telescope, one of the world’s largest, had agreed to pause construction to allow interested parties to have more discussions about the project.

headline.main: Hawaii: Work on Giant Telescope Is Paused
